qas.question: To stop reliance on what was GM cotton developed?
What form of cotton is GM?
What bacterium is used to produced GM cotton?
What farming pest management technique does the use of GM grown plants promote?
What part of the life cycle of moths does Bt toxin effect?
To stop refinance on what was GM larvae developed?
What form of larvae is larvae?
What farming pest management technique does the use of larvae grown plants promote?
What part of the life cycle of cotton does Bt toxin effect
What bacterium is used to produce larvae cotton?

context: <a1_0><b6_0>Genetically modified<b6_0/><a1_0/> (GM) cotton was developed to reduce the heavy reliance on <a0_0><b5_0>pesticides<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The bacterium <a2_0><b9_0>Bacillus thuringiensis<b9_0/><a2_0/> (Bt) naturally produces a chemical harmful only to a small fraction of insects, most notably the <a4_0>larvae<a4_0/> of moths and butterflies, beetles, and flies, and harmless to other forms of life. The gene coding for Bt toxin has been inserted into cotton, causing cotton, called Bt cotton, to produce this natural insecticide in its tissues. In many regions, the main pests in commercial cotton are lepidopteran <b8_0>larvae<b8_0/>, which are killed by the Bt protein in the transgenic cotton they eat. This eliminates the need to use large amounts of broad-spectrum insecticides to kill lepidopteran pests (some of which have developed pyrethroid resistance). This spares natural insect predators in the farm ecology and further contributes to <a3_0><b7_0>noninsecticide<b7_0/><a3_0/> pest management.
